channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree foliage is blocking the footpath, 27th June
item.description:
The tree branches have overgrown outwards toward the footpath and the road. This footpath is heavily used by parents dropping and collecting their kids from the local school. They are forced to walk in the road because of the tree branches and foliage. Please prune back this tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodville Street, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More abandoned bins, 27th June
item.description:
These 4 bins have been abandoned on the corner for weeks. They do not belong to the flats on the corner or any of the adjacent houses. Their presence encourages fly tipping of other items. This is a recurring problem. Don't know why this corner is so popular for disposing of unwanted bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Dunstan's Grove, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public overgrown and overhanging tree, 27th June
item.description:
Since 2024, the tree outside no's 41 and 43 Cloisters avenue is overhanging both drives, and also growing outwards from the trunk across the small pavement. The tree is also obscuring the street light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cloisters Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface is sinking near to rainwater drain, 27th June
item.description:
This is getting steadily deeper causing cars to bottom out as they brake approaching the bend .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingswood Avenue, Lessness Heath, London

item.title: Untaxed vehicle, 27th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Archery Lane, Bromley Common, London

item.title: Overgrown bushes and weeds and trees obstructing alleyway, 27th June
item.description:
The alleyway which runs alongside bexley grammar school, from Radnor Avenue to danson lane. It’s a public footpath that people use everyday, it’s becoming increasingly narrow due to overgrown bushes and trees etc. when walking my children home from school they are often getting caught by thorns and stinging nettles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 66 Woodsome Road, 27th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodsome Road, Dartmouth Park, London

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26-46, Wotton Green, St Mary Cray, London

item.title: Unsafe & illegal building works - Blocking resident & emergency services access, 27th June
item.description:
This building works continues to ignore building & HS laws..so unsafe ! The council visited this site a short time ago claiming the alley access is private and can't do anything to clear materials yet every year write to residents demanding we keep it clear gor emergencyservices! Go figure ! Perhaps they're all mates..These dodgy builders and works are shocking and unsafe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Edmunds Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: O/S St Annes Court, 27th June
item.description:
An old tree has died due to a large lump on where it was planted. This has limited tree growth and tree has now died (removed). Please can the lump be looked into and a new tree planted?
